description: Underpinning foundations to front porch and reconstruction of plinth walls and floor of porch; repairs and repointing of north west corner of house (Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.   Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, (as amended). | 2.	Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the works permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To safeguard the architectural and/or historic interest of the building and the Bedford Park Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 7C of the Ealing Development Plan DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (h) and 1.2 (g) of the Local Development Framework - Adopted Core Strategy (2012), policy 7.8 of the London Plan and the Bedford Park Conservation Area Management Plan (September 2007). | 3.	If hitherto unknown evidence of historic character that would be affected by the works hereby permitted is discovered or likely to be revealed, an appropriate record together with recommendations for dealing with it in the context of the scheme, shall be submitted in writing to the Local Planning Authority before any alterations take place.   Reason: To safeguard the character of the listed building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.8 of The London Plan (2015) and polices 7.4 and 7C of the Adopted Development Management Plan (2013).
